author: Ryan Tracy
title: The Fine Print: What’s in the Senate Financial-Regulation Bill
text:
The Senate is voting on a bill as early as this week that would make the largest changes to financial regulatory law since 2010, when the Dodd-Frank Act passed. Opponents say the bill cuts protections against consumer abuses and financial crises. Supporters say it will help small lenders without undoing Dodd-Frank’s core tenets.
Decide for yourself. Here’s what’s in Senate Bill 2155.
Help for Regional Banks
